entry.et: Medieval Latin mappa, from Latin, napkin, towel

def.dt: :a representation usually on a flat surface of the whole or a part of an area
:a representation of the celestial sphere or a part of it
:something that represents with a clarity suggestive of a map the Freudian map of the mind Harold Bloom
:the arrangement of genes on a chromosome called also genetic map
:function 5a
:marked by a high degree of variation
:in a position of prominence or fame had put the fledgling university on the map Lon Tinkle
:to make a map of map the surface of the moon
:to delineate as if on a map sorrow was mapped on her face
:to make a survey of for or as if for the purpose of making a map
:to assign (as a set or element) in a mathematical or exact correspondence map picture elements to video memory
:to plan in detail often used with out map out a program
:to locate (a gene) on a chromosome
:to be located
:to be assigned in a relation or connection the major problems confronting humankind … do not map well onto the traditional disciplines P. W. Porter
modified American plan
Walter ca 1140–ca 1209 Eng. writer
:a map having contour lines
:map 3
:a map representing topographic relief
:a map showing roads especially for automobile travel
:a detailed plan to guide progress toward a goal
:a detailed explanation
:a map or chart showing the principal meteorological elements at a given hour and over an extended region
